explain: a record of money spent or received
a plan for how much money will be spent
not happy because what was wished for did not happen
a place where a living thing can be safe
a material in soil that helps a plant live and grow
a small wooden house, usually built in the forest or mountains
containers with flat sides used to hold or carry things
coins and paper bills that people use to buy things
a small creature with eight legs that spins webs to catch insects
statement: The boys received some money for raking leaves in the yard.
received
The girl opened a bank account with the money from her allowance.
account
A budget is a plan for how you should spend your money.
budget
He was disappointed, or sad, that he would not be able to buy the book.
disappointed
Plants and animals are living things.
living things
Some animals use a hole in a tree for shelter.
shelter
The umbrella can protect the family from the hot sun.
protect
Roots take in water and nutrients from the soil.
nutrients
The family stayed in a warm cabin near the lake during the cold winter.
cabin
The teacher packed all the books into boxes before moving to the new classroom.
boxes
She saved her money each week so she could buy a gift for her friend.
money
A spider spun a thin web between two branches to catch insects for food.
spider
